intro: Ladeania juncea, commonly known as the slender ladeania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ladeania juncea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
